oneliner: Provides a hands-on design and simulation capabilities for HAWT and VAWT rotor design and shows all the fundamental relationships of design concepts and turbine performance in an easy and intuitive way.
An AEP calculator for wind farms implemented in Python including a collection of wake models.
A Python package developed by DTU Wind Energy to help with wind-farm optimizations.
The scope of this project is to provide an open source, open access controller that can be used by the wind energy community as a reference.
A collection of Python scripts that facilitate working with (potentially a lot) of HAWC2,HAWCStab2, FAST or other text input based simulation tools.
Constrained Stochastic Turbulence for Wind Energy Applications.
A scientific open source project for the development of numerical methods for the simulation of thermo-hydro-mechanical-chemical processes in porous and fractured media.
Software for techno-economic Simulation of Stationary Energy Storage Systems.
A flexible, robust, and computationally scalable open-architecture framework that integrates multi-physics and multi- scale battery models.
Open Battery Models for Electrical Grid Applications.
Linear Programming Optimization Tool for Battery Energy Storage Systems.
Allows coupled electrical-thermal simulations of single storage systems (e.g. lithium ion batteries or double layer capacitors) or complete storage system packs.
Methods to create an automated network model of the European gas transportation network.
Largest multi-city traffic dataset publicly available.
Driving the Evolution and Broad Adoption of Open Source Mobility Modeling and Simulation Technologies.

The objective to start this project is primarily to support the ISO and IEC standardization process to specify the so called "Vehicle 2 Grid Communication Interface" (V2G CI) which became the ISO IEC 15118 specification by now.
Improve the energy efficiency of free and open source software.
Used to explore future energy systems and are often applied to questions involving energy and climate policy.
This page lists energy models published under open source licenses.
An easy to use open source tool for power system modeling, analysis and optimization with a high degree of automation.
A simulator for cyber-physical power systems that makes use of high performance computing techniques to scale up the simulation.
A real-time power system simulator that operates in the dynamic phasor as well as electromagnetic transient domain.
Connecting real-time power grid simulation equipment.
Aims to be an energy systems modeling tool for linear optimization (LP, MILP).
A techno-economic model of the north-west European power market covering France, Benelux, Germany and Poland.
A lightweight simulation tool for high level analyses of renewable energy integration in large power systems.
A Matlab toolbox for electric power system analysis and simulation.
An electric power Distribution System Simulator for supporting distributed resource integration and grid modernization efforts.
Open Automated Demand Response (OpenADR) is an open and interoperable information exchange model and emerging smart grid standard.
A generic energy network optimization tool written in GAMS.
The focus will be on the European transmission grids, but the methods will be applicable more generally.
Industrial grade open source real-time platform that can run virtualized automation and protection applications for the power grid industry.
A list of primary data sources that are helpful for power system modeling of Europe.

project_name: Photovoltaic time series for European countries
oneliner: Comprises 38 years-long hourly time series representing the photovoltaic capacity factors in every European country (EU-28 plus Serbia, Bosnia-Herzegovina, Norway, and Switzerland).
A knowledge-sharing online community dedicated to connecting people with the latest information and data on energy resources from around the world.
This data set contains precisely time stamped (GPS referenced) frequency data from several power grids around the world in one second resolution and 1 hour excerpts of raw data.
Offers an overview of free datasets for modelling energy demand and generation.
Online hub for sharing solar-related knowledge and data from the Northern Territory, Australia.
A multi-scale photochemical modeling system for gas and particulate air pollution.

Based on the DUNE framework and aims to provide a multitude of numerical models as well as flexible discretization methods for complex non-linear phenomena, such as CO2 sequestration, soil remediation, drug delivery in cancer therapy and more.
